Uses of Interface
spoon.reflect.visitor.chain.CtQuery

  • Packages that use CtQuery 
    Package Description
    spoon.reflect
    This package defines the Spoon's compile-time meta-model of Java programs.
    spoon.reflect.factory
    This package defines all the sub-factories for the Spoon meta-model.
    spoon.reflect.visitor.chain  
    spoon.reflect.visitor.filter
    This package contains a set of useful filters when querying the model.
    spoon.support.reflect.declaration

    • Uses of CtQuery in spoon.reflect.visitor.chain

      Classes in spoon.reflect.visitor.chain that implement CtQuery 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CtQueryImpl
      The facade of CtQuery which represents a query bound to the CtElement, which is the constant input of this query.
      Methods in spoon.reflect.visitor.chain with type parameters of type CtQuery 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T extends CtQuery>
      T      		 CtQuery.setInput(java.lang.Object... input)
      Sets (binds) the input of the query.
      Methods in spoon.reflect.visitor.chain that return CtQuery 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CtQuery CtQuery.failurePolicy(QueryFailurePolicy policy)
      Defines whether this query will throw ClassCastException when the output of the previous step cannot be cast to type of input of next step.
      <R extends CtElement>
      CtQuery      		 CtQueryable.filterChildren(Filter<R> filter) 
      <R extends CtElement>
      CtQuery      		 CtQuery.filterChildren(Filter<R> filter)
      Recursively scans all children elements of an input element.
      <I> CtQuery CtQueryable.map(CtConsumableFunction<I> queryStep) 
      <I> CtQuery CtQuery.map(CtConsumableFunction<I> queryStep)
      Same as map(CtFunction), but the returned object is not handled by java's return statement, but by a call to CtConsumer.accept(Object), this allows efficient and easy to write chained processing, see CtConsumableFunction.
      <I,R> CtQuery CtQueryable.map(CtFunction<I,R> function) 
      <I,R> CtQuery CtQuery.map(CtFunction<I,R> function)
      Query elements based on a function, the behavior depends on the return type of the function.
      CtQuery CtQuery.name(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the name of current query, to identify the current step during debugging of a query
      <R extends CtElement>
      CtQuery      		 CtQuery.select(Filter<R> filter)
      The matched element for which (filter.matches(element)==true) is sent to the next query step.
      Methods in spoon.reflect.visitor.chain with parameters of type CtQuery 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void CtQueryAware.setQuery(CtQuery query)
      This method is called when the filter/function is added as a step to a CtQuery by the query engine (CtQueryImpl).
